review_title: You will never get a raise
pros: Benefits and time off. Towson is a decent location to work. There isn’t much more than that
cons: Don’t ever expect to get a fair salary. You have to quit before they are willing to consider a market adjustment. You honestly will be paid at least $20k -$30k below what the market dictates. HR releases personal information about employees via gossip. They will not give certain people a flexible or remote schedule just because. They refuse to provide accommodations for those with health issues. Understaffed. Overworked, underpaid. This place is where people go to let their careers die seriously

pros: I worked with peer tutors and students who are amazing. Tutors put so much effort into their jobs. Students are polite and many are extremely hard working. I also enjoyed working with graduate assistants and other colleagues in the university. I had freedom to attend professional development activities on campus and even worked a flex schedule to accommodate my class at UMD. Awesome benefits, especially leave.
cons: My director had her head in the clouds. We had a really problematic person who has been at the university for a long time, is close to retirement, and this person made many other people in the office miserable, which I think was their goal. When I was new, the director didn't give a while lot of direction, which is the flip side to the freedom I mentioned above. our office was also jointly in charge of a program for students on academic suspension, and the university provided no funding whatsoever for us to provide those students with more individualized attention. That program was just heaped onto our existing responsibilities. Frustrating that administration cares so little about students who need extra help, usually because they have unusual events or extenuating circumstances in their lives.

review_title: Towson University's people and culture are a true pleasure to be part of.
job_title: Director of Marketing in Towson, MD
pros:
The people at Towson love working there are are very team oriented and willing to help you out
Most of the top leadership are good, solid leaders who represent Towson's overall great culture well
Great location!
You'll have the opportunity to shine--Towson is very entrepreneurial and empowering--but not necessarily the opportunity to advance within
cons:
Top leadership is in flux right now June 2011 (president search) but I suspect we'll recruit a star
As a state system school, the state-imposed budget constraints due to the economy are hitting hard, including employee furloughs for two years
The provost/interim president is counter to our culture and not well-regarded
Professional advancement opps are questionable, but Towson is a great university to have on your resume--very respected in-state and nearby

review_title: Faculty Solid; Admin Weak, Vision Missing
pros: dept of kinesiology faculty outstanding!
cons: Kinesiology faculty compensation extremely low (you value finance profs much higher...pathetic!!!); Dean of College weak and a follow-order functionary careerist; vision beyond building new spaces thru 2020 is absent...what difference, besides being a repository for the state student capacity that couldn't get into College Park, does Towson see for itself?

review_title: A good company to work for someone just graduating from college.
pros: Nice work environment; the team was young and helpful; I was able to work on different projects; Management was trying to create a nice atmosphere with happy hours and team retreats.
cons: The team I work for was small and the projects were not intellectually stimulating. Plus, you mostly work alone because you perform research and come up with your own conclusions. I realized that I prefer to work in a more dynamic environment. Also, the group relies a lot on state grants, which are not abundant, so I was always under the threat of being laid-off. Finally, the group was always re-organizing, which can become annoying after a while.

review_title: Overall it was a good experience until new leadership was hired and I was not given a chance to show my abilities.
job_title: Senior Associate Director of Athletics in Towson, MD
pros: The employees are trying to make a difference and grow the program and are willing to work together to accomplish goals.  There was direction given from the top and it was shared with the staff and they were even included in help forming those goals.
cons: The University is trying to grow very fast and has very high expectations, but within my area we were not given the resources to try and meet those expectations.  Additionally, we went through furloughs and salary cuts that help lead to additional frustration among staff.

review_title: Great people, some problems that are general to all universities, some unique to Towson.
pros: In my experience of teaching for a department in Liberal Arts I found  the departmental faculty and staff excellent. They were constantly helpful, friendly and encouraging. The liberal arts building is a nice place to teach with modern facilities and excellent classroom technology. It's a little anemic and characterless, but they are going for something somewhat minimalist. (One of the rooms was used as the room for when Frank Underwood from House of Cards was shot and in hospital. They filmed some of the episodes there over the summer. Unfortunately I didn't run into Claire or Frank. It is somewhat telling that you can take a classroom and pass it off as a hospital room). The student body is diverse and interesting coming generally from the greater Baltimore area and surrounding counties.
cons: As a lecturer with no other departmental responsibilities I was somewhat isolated from the rest of the staff. This was in part a result of my own choices but I was never actively invited to participate in the life of the department beyond the public events the department put on. This is reflected, to a degree, in the institutional status of non-tenure track faculty. Even as a full-time lecturer teaching a 4-4 load, I had the status of "contingent faculty" in the university system. This meant, for example, I couldn't have the fee for parking deducted from my monthly paycheck, it had to be taken out in three lump sums. This was tough at the start of the semester when you are already strapped having not been paid over the summer. (You are paid ten months of the year as a lecturer). This is connected to another issue: parking. The tenured faculty I knew lived somewhat nearby and opted not to drive. This wasn't an option for me so I had to pay for parking which rose to around $400 for the year. Towson is a commuter campus with way more students and cars then parking spaces. Students often complain about the expense of parking on campus.

pros: You can attend night classes while working by tuition remission
cons: It is difficult to earn a degree because supervisors are not flexible. Also it is difficult to move around because of favoritism with other employees or just hiring friends and family to help elevate their growth potential instead of the employees with seniority and experience.

unfriendly and entitled attitudes from supervisors

review_title: Full of wonderful people--it's the past few presidents who are the problem
job_title: Director of Marketing in Towson, MD
pros: TU is generally a great place to work. It's full of wonderful people, many of whom have been there a long time. All the usual university perks/benefits apply.
cons: Recent presidents have greatly eroded many of the things that make Towson great in service of their own ambition. The golden days of Dr. Caret's leadership are long gone. Hopefully, the presidential search committee will do a better job the next time around.

job_title: Student Ambassador Team Leader in Towson, MD
pros: Towson really works with their students to provide job opportunities while attending school. Being a Student Ambassador really gave me an inside look at the university while also pursuing my degree. The hours are really flexible, and the staff and management are awesome people to work with!
cons: Sometimes it is hard to get enough hours to make a decent salary, but then again we are all students taking classes.

job_title: Teaching Assistant Biology in Towson, MD
pros: Great coworkers, friendly environment, covers tuition (graduate level), great way to earn a Masters if you don't mind being broke, In charge of your own class (no other teachers for biology), looks good on a resume
cons: Poor pay, difficult to afford living expenses on, tuition fees are not cover and can be over $100 per credit hour, pay is lower than adjunct teachers who are doing the same work as you

job_title: Adjunct Professor in New Freedom, PA
pros: I work with some great people and the schedule is flexible. The students are for the most part nice and easy to work with. There are always exceptions, of course.
cons: The pay is not very good. You have to pay for parking and that can be expensive. It's a public university so you have to be concerned about the state budget.

pros: friendly and supportive people, dedicated employees, stress levels were reasonable, you really feel as if people care about you here
cons: part-time contractual positions have little to no benefits, if you do not have a phD and you would like to teach it is not the place to work, high turnover in some departments

review_title: It's Good, If You're a Student Worker.
job_title: Multimedia Specialist/Service Desk in Towson, MD
pros:
-Simple Job
-People are cool.
-Gives you a chance to learn more about what you want to specialize in later in life.
cons:
-Management is such a mess of politics, it can get pretty frustrating.
-Some higher-ups treat you as if you're mentally incapable of the easiest of tasks.
-There was a pay-freeze on just main staff and everyone had to suffer for it.
-Management promotions are based arbitrarily instead of on merit, or seniority.

pros: I had a student job that was very flexible and fun to work with fellow students. It was a typical minimum wage job, nothing special
cons: There obviously wasn't much room for growth, because I was just a student worker. Raises were minimal and I eventually left because I wasn't going anywhere.

job_title: Student Textbook Assistant in Towson, MD
pros: Studies and family always came first. I loved my coworkers and working with other students on campus. Many great career opportunities and experiences to build my resume.
cons: Due to being a student, the pay wasn't great. However, working on campus and working around school hours did help compensate for low pay.

pros: Much of the faculty/staff has social justice attitudes but their hands are often constrained by the narrow thinking administration.. There is a diversity among the student body but sadly, more outside of the College of Education. Great library and staff to assist student bodies.
cons: LOW salaries! Old buildings. Poor parking.  UN"WOKE" administration.  Too much funds going to sports and not to academics.

review_title: Great job that works around your class schedule
job_title: Community Center Assistant in Towson, MD
pros: Mostly slow paced job, unless a school event is happening. Depending on the building you are allowed to do homework, use the internet and computer at the desk. Great coworkers and usually friendly residence. (Building dependent again).
cons: Can be difficult depending on the shifts you are assigned. Sometimes you get disgruntled parents angry about something and they are irritating to deal with, but you can just sick the Resident Life Coordinator on them.

pros: Students are positive and department provides academically well-organized setting for faculties and students. It is located in mid-scale city near Washington D.C.
cons: Salary and benefit for lecturer position is too low and no possibility to be promoted to senior lecturer. Advising load is huge due to increasing number of students.

pros: Lots of autonomy, control over what I teach and the research projects that I undertake. Good collegiality, students who value good teaching.
cons: Business school - lack of leadership, vision, and integrity. Little support for research or travel 3-3 load with an expectation for reasonable research productivity

review_title: There was very little assistance or supervision given to me as a new employee.
pros: I was given a fair amount of autonomy in how to teach the content. Other teachers were willing to lend suggestions.
cons: The pay is low and in addition they charge you for parking, which us also difficult to find on campus. The department administration was not very helpful in getting started.

pros:
--Friendly, supportive staff. Want to see you succeed.
--Grad students working 20 hrs/week in a grad assistantship can get 12credits of tuition waived, plus a stipend of $5000 for the year.
--Check ins with senior staff on a semesterly basis
cons: --Due to the size of the institution, it can take time to make connections across departments. I met someone toward the end of my 2 year GA position who could have helped a lot had I known them sooner!

pros: Towson is the premier Education school in Maryland. Our top education students are a national treasure.
cons: Fair to middling students. Some students are wonderful but many treat college as grade thirteen. There is pressure to pander to the student-as-consumer by inflating grades. Out of state students pay high tuition but are dragging our standards down.

pros: Very convienent location, I got to make my own schedule, I was not micromanaged, some of the faculty is awesome
cons: After working the same position for three years i received no raise and there was no opertunities for growth.

job_title: Financial Transaction Coordinator in Towson, MD
pros: great PTO, Holiday and sick time.  Most of the people are nice, campus is beautiful, great work life balance
cons: I have worked here for almost 15 years, I have gone more years with no pay raise, than years with pay raise.  It is easy to get "stuck" once you hit a certain level, there is no room for advancement.

job_title: Undergraduate Marketing Student Job in Towson, MD
pros: Easy to work for them while attending classes at the same time.  As a student, they accommodate your school before the job.
cons: The pay is a bit low, but my the area of the department has such a low budget, that can be expected.

pros: The location is the best reason to work at Towson. Towson is located between Washington and New York City. If you like urban areas, their location is ideal.
cons: Lack of transparency in management practices; administration does not apply procedures specified in handbooks; lack of shared governance (high ranking administrators make decisions with disregard for faculty voice).

review_title: Good benefits, no motivation to put in extra effort
pros:
Very relaxed, friendly environment.
Benefits can't be beat anywhere.
Excellent work/life balance.
cons:
No opportunity for career advancement.
Many business practices are behind the times.
Much unneeded bureacracy.
Lots of "lifers" employed here, especially in management positions; new blood needed for fresh ideas.

review_title: It was a good experience for low pay.
pros: You had good hours, and good coworkers.  The people were friendly and always accommodating. They made a point to help out new individuals and make sure you understood what was going on.
cons: Very low pay, inconsistent work.  You never knew when you would have classes the next semester and they scheduled late.

pros: co-workers are willing to help one another.  students' interests are considered at all times.  easy to get time off.  good work/life balance
cons: lots of construction on campus so its changing alot.  The parking situation is ridiculous.

pros: Working at Towson allowed employees to network and learn how to communicate well with others. Was a great introductory job.
cons: Management could be disrespectful to some employees if they didn't like them as much. Occasionally belittled them in front of other employees.

review_title: It was extremely positive and I would definitely go back! Was looking for the next step up
job_title: Residence Life Coordinator in Towson, MD
pros: Meals and rent were included in the plan, so that was a plus! The students are amazing and really engaged.
cons: You’re definitely going to be working over 40 hours a week, so just be prepared for that. There’s also a lot of “other duties as assigned.”

pros: Occasionally you will have a handful of students who care about learning and not grades. Elbow patches on tweeds not required.
cons: No benefits, low pay, the university standard for getting in appears to be wether or not you can get a student loan.

pros: Good work place environment, with a lot of work to do at any given time. managers are willing to work with you to help in what ever research that may be occuring
cons: At times the work here seems extraordinarily tedious and can get very boring. There is no lack of work, but there is a lack of quality work to do.

review_title: Very easy going company,MOSTLY,everybody gets along,well and does their job!
pros: I like MOST of the people,I like my job and I like my schedule!
cons: There are problems,where ever you go,but,unfortunitly,the Union here,is preventing them from Firing people,that need to be Fired!

pros: This was a great experience for me. The management is great and the university itself is extremely rewarding. Definitely would recommend to anyone.
cons: Some of the downsides of Towson include its lack of structure. There is no real chain of command. A lot of tasks and criticism are lost in this chain.

review_title: Good Part Time Job for Student
job_title: Community Center Assistant in Towson, MD
pros: developed customer service skills. felt more connected to the community. built relationship with coworkers (other cca's, resident assistants, the manager, and residence life coordinator), good on campus job
cons: not the best work hours, no upward movement in company unless trying to become a resident assisstant or community center manager.

pros: Enjoyed it a lot.  Training definitely had it's useful moments.  Felt prepared to help students begin their Towson experience.
cons: Too much of an emphasis on StrengthsQuest throughout training process.  Having two orientation groups on the different days made it difficult to really engage and get to know students.

pros: Great people with many campus opportunities. Working on an academic campus is terrific and the state benefits are very good.
cons: If you are ambitious you may be frustrated because you may be locked into one level of service and pay raises with the state are basically not available.

review_title: Great benefits, hard to be a female
job_title: Assistant Coach, College Or University in Towson, MD
pros: Benefits to UM system employees are above average. Some excellent people work there.
cons: Systemic and blatant sexism by athletic administration.

review_title: If they could fix the pay issue, this would be a fantastic job
pros:
Great benefits package
Willing to understand work / life trade-off
Great scenery
cons: All money related: Low pay, furlough days due to being affiliated with the State of MD, and haven't received COLA in three years

pros: generous state benefits were offered
cons: Extremely racist management. The admissions department only intends to hire and retain caucasian employees.  They hire family members and promote only relatives and close friends. The manager arrived late and left early every day.  TU promotes that they are diverse when in reality they only want people of color's money. TU is a silent plantation full of racist caucasian employees.

pros:
Unique and fresh environment
Success is easy if you are driven and motivated
cons: Some people who came there straight out of college and continued working for them for a long time might not match the effort or skill of a field seasoned professional

pros: Great Benefits, for the most part a really welcoming campus.  Location and commute is reasonable from Baltimore City.
cons: In my department, overall vision and guidance is lacking.  The emphasis is more on face time instead of productivity.

review_title: Nice Place to Work If You Can Afford It
pros: Wonderful co-workers, challenging work, interesting work conducted by professors in many fields.
cons: The money is at least 10 years behind. Cronyism

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Upper Marlboro, MD
pros: Great with developing skills and talent. It's a great place to really come into your own.
cons: Poor communication and advancement. Once you are in a role there is not a clear way to advance your career without leaving and coming back.

review_title: Brainless job, but gives a huge tuition reimbursement
pros: Working in the library was easy and they also gave a HUGE tuition reimbursement.
cons: Obviously, you learn no marketable job skills sitting in a library all day.

pros: Nice life/work balance.  Important to University's mission.
cons: Division of Innovation and Applied Research which is part to TU is mismanaged and lacking consistent business processes and leadership.

review_title: Nine place to work if you are interested in teaching a class
pros: Nice environment and good students, supportive staff. I feel included and valued.
cons: An adjunct teacher does not have the resources to help students as much as I would like.

pros: Good, supportive work environment. All supplies provided
cons: Dead end for Adjunct/ Teaching Professors. That doesn't make the university bad, there is just not a lot of opportunity to go somewhere from being an adjunct.

pros: The students are wonderful.  Great campus.
cons: Management from top down.... rather that shared governance.

review_title: The Worst Job of My Life
pros: None Towson is a terrible place to work.
cons: Low salary, poor working conditions, salary was cut and frozen several times in a year. Office was a shared space with peeling paint, no heat, no air conditioning, and no Internet access.

job_title: Student Building Manager in Towson, MD
pros: Schedules around your classes/prior obligations, position of leadership, become familiar with several members of the Towson community
cons: Long and late night shifts, sometimes unclear communication between student and full-time employees

pros: Leadership experience and social skill improvement
cons: Does not provide food, so all of the money you make over the summer is going towards paying for food.

pros: Very supportive and engaging.   Tuition benefits available to graduate assistant.  Great opportunity to teach.
cons: Overall, I love TU.  No cons comes to mind right now.

pros: Employer can provide decent stability
cons: Executive management in my division was clueless

job_title: Class Monitor in Perry Hall, MD
pros: Yeah, if you are a student, they will work around your schedule and they are very understanding.
cons: I have none at the moment.

pros: Relaxed environment, nice and safe campus.
cons:
The computer science labs are not suitable for a university. 
Pay scale is not competitive.

job_title: Multimedia Support Specialist in Towson, MD
pros: Great work atmosphere. Lot of experience lot of experience troubleshooting hardware and software. Made new life long friends. Opens doors to careers.
cons: Pay is not that great.

pros: They allow non tenure track faculty to be an integral part of projects and research
cons: I have no cons to date

pros: Freedom and opportunity to do what you want as a professional.
cons:
No benefits
No parking
No care at all about part-time employees

pros: Awesome management, great staff, fun events to work
cons: hard to schedule with classes

pros: The work life balance and work community is strong.  Benefits are amazing
cons: Less base compensation that private sector

job_title: Field Placement Supervisor in Towson, MD
pros: Wonderful environment to work.  From the administration, faculty and staff, everyone worked together for the betterment of the students.
cons: I really can't think of any.

pros: you can do homework, get to know other students, flexible schedule, good pay
cons: I really have nothing bad to say why is there a 20 word minimum

review_title: Student Employee at The Career Center
pros: Great place to work, low stress job, great coworkers, very flexible with student schedules
cons: Minimum wage, sometimes hard to get enough hours

review_title: I’ve been very impressed by the faculty.
pros: small class sizes, lots of individual attention
cons: academic advisors are difficult to work with

pros: The work environment is pretty relaxing, the staff are friendly
cons: No cons when I was working there

pros: Excellent academic and program facilities
cons: Large organization so easy to get lost in the numbers

pros: Great way to save money, and connect with people on different levels.
cons: Can be hard to balance school and RA job at the same time.

pros: As a research assistant you get hands-on experience by doing research.
cons: Some limitations of resources that sometimes will hinder the process of projects.

pros: Tuition remission is great to further your education.
cons: Pay is a disgrace. Was in a “masters preferred” position and barely made a living wage.

review_title: Amazing opportunity to grow as a professional, mentor, and scholar
pros: career-readiness and networking opportunities; great staff and students

review_title: Great learning experience. Pretty wonderful students.
pros: Great student population, tuition remission, flexible hours
cons: There is nothing they need to work on!

pros: Off work when school closes for major holidays and inclement weather, benefits of campus life

Beautiful working and studying environment.

pros: Great way to make extra cash and meet new people

pros: My mentors were great and understanding of my school priorities.
